law
  specialized abbreviation for family liaison officer: a specially trained police officer who supports the family of someone who has been murdered or killed in a road accident, etc.: The FLO replied that all those in all hospitals had been identified and accounted for, but the morgue was full of bodies waiting to be identified.
education
  specialized abbreviation for family liaison officer: a specially trained person who supports the family of a child who is having problems at school, especially to help with problems in the family that affect the child's learning: The role of the FLO is to assist in tackling underachievement by working in partnership with families.
More examplesFewer examplesThe FLO will find out whether the family wish to meet the reviewing lawyer.The FLO, who was wonderful, tried to help us understand everything the two girls had done on their last night.They assigned a FLO to us - a depressing sign that things were indeed very serious.The FLO works directly with parents in a non-judgmental way, empowering them and their families to get the most out of the educational opportunities available.
